intro: Stevia pennellii, commonly known as sweetleaf, is a perennial shrub native to Paraguay and Brazil. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that contain high concentrations of steviol glycosides, which are naturally occurring sweeteners. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine and as a natural sweetener in food products. Stevia pennellii is well adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and thrives in well-drained soil.
